page.title: 02THE NORTH-WEST VIEW.
page.content: Looking north-west from the highest point,the overall view is one of hills and valleys. Directly northwards the entire town of Silsden can be seen.The mills are concentrated in the centre with large housing estates extending to either side.Behind Silsden is the faint outline of Great Whernside. Farnhill and Kildwick can be seen to the N.W. and Kildwick Hall is clearly visible at night when it is lit up. Farnhill Pinnacle can be seen on top of the hill and looking further west, Cowling Pinnacle is visible. Looking West one can see the peaks of the Yorkshire Dales including Pen-y-ghent which is 2273ft.Also visible is the end of the glaciated Aire Valley and part of Skipton.The further west one travels,the more rural the area becomes.
